body.name: Storkcraft Santa Monica 5-in-1 Convertible Crib (White with Vintage Driftwood) – GREENGUARD Gold Certified, Modern Design, Two-Tone Baby Crib, Converts to Toddler Bed, Daybed and Full-Size Bed
deliveryMessages: FREE delivery Tuesday, February 20. Order within 3 hrs 51 mins
features: 5-IN-1 CONVERTIBLE CRIB: Converts from baby crib (mattress sold separately) to toddler bed (toddler guardrail sold separately), daybed, and full-size bed with headboard & optional footboard (conversion kit sold separately); Assembly required

ADAPTS TO YOUR GROWING BABY: Adjustable mattress support base with 3 different height options; Designed to fit any standard full-size crib & toddler mattress; This baby crib may be used until your child can easily climb out or is taller than 35in (89cm)

GREENGUARD GOLD CERTIFIED, JPMA CERTIFIED: GREENGUARD Gold Certified products are screened for more than 10,000 chemicals and VOCs known to pollute indoor air; Expert tested to meet or exceed all applicable category voluntary and mandatory safety standards
QUALITY CRAFTSMANSHIP: Crafted with pine wood, engineered wood, and wood composites; Packaging tested to reduce the risk of incidental damage that could occur during shipment

AWARD-WINNING BRAND: Exclusively from Storkcraft, proud recipient of the 2022 Women’s Choice Award for 9 out of 10 Customer Recommended Baby & Kids Furniture and Parent Tested Parent Approved (PTPA) Seal of Approval for nursery and children’s furniture
body.description: Two-tone style, architectural inspiration, and timeless style — introducing our Santa Monica crib. The Santa Monica is GREENGUARD Gold Certified — meaning it’s been screened for over 10,000 chemicals and volatile organic compounds (VOCs) known to pollute indoor air. The Santa Monica is crafted from pine wood, and is available in multiple non-toxic finishes to bring your dream nursery to life. Designed to adapt to your growing child, the Santa Monica easily converts from a crib into a toddler bed, daybed, full-size bed with headboard only, and full-size bed with both headboard & footboard. Also, it’s equipped with a 3-position adjustable mattress support base that can be repositioned as your child grows. The Santa Monica fits any standard full-size crib and toddler mattress (we recommend any Graco crib mattress) and is compatible with 1 or 2 of our universal toddler safety guardrails. In addition to being GREENGUARD Gold Certified, the Santa Monica is JPMA Certified — meaning it’s been expert tested by independent laboratories to guarantee that it meets the highest standards for your child’s safety. Also, Storkcraft is the proud recipient of the Parent Tested Parent Approved Seal of Approval and 2022 Women's Choice Award for 9 out of 10 Recommended Baby & Kids Furniture. Assembly required. Crib mattress sold separately. Toddler safety guardrail sold separately. Full-size crib conversion kit sold separately.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on August 19, 2022
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Great All-in-One Crib - But You May Need One More Thing
reviews.reviewText: There's a reason why Storkcraft is known for making great cribs. It's because they also make all of Graco's cribs. And every parent knows the Graco brand. It's probably the most trusted for car seats and strollers. So if you're looking for a crib that's competitively priced, but still sturdy and safe, the Santa Monica is a good choice. Best of all, it grows with your child. So you can eventually turn it into a day bed, or a traditional looking bed when your little one gets to be not-so-little anymore. But there is one thing you may want to consider buying with this. Especially if you're getting it as a baby shower gift, or present for other parents. Here's what you need.....A conversion kit. For some reason, every 4-in-1 or 5-in-1 crib that my Wife and I ever looked at, didn't include a conversion kit. We just sort of assumed that when it was time to turn the crib into a regular bed, I'd just be taking it apart, and assembling it in a different way. I found out the hard way with our very first convertible crib that you couldn't do that. You needed a specific kit and/or an additional rail piece. The brand we chose for the first crib we bought, they were sold out of the kit we needed for our particular crib (it wasn't a Storkcraft). So if you want to avoid a situation like that, you may want to consider just getting a conversion kit now. Better to have it and not need it two or three years from now, than need it and just not have it. Especially if the kits are sold out at that time, or not being produced anymore.Storkcraft has a couple of conversion kits priced at about $140 or so. They work with all types of Storkcraft and Graco brand cribs. It's what you need to convert the crib into a bed. If you're gifting it, it's fine to just gift the crib. But it wouldn't hurt if you also include one of their bed conversion kits, if you can swing the extra $140 right now. They sell them on Amazon, so you can actually have it ship out the same time as the crib itself. Or check with Storkcraft directly to see what they have available. Just be sure to order the crib here on Amazon for the best and fastest shipping. Great crib, we got this one specifically for our baby nephew when family is staying the night at our place. Simple but attractive and functional.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 15, 2024
Reviewed in the United States on January 2, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Nifty lightweight crib
reviews.reviewText: This convertible crib is the convenient option for transitioning from a baby to a toddler bed. It comes in white with a brown base, so it’s generally easy to match with other nursery furniture. It takes about anywhere between one and two hours to put together, depending on the speed of the assembler. One tricky aspect of the assembly is that many of the bolts can only be tightened from behind obstructions in the frame, so they can't be tightened in a continuous maneuver.Though the material is synthetic and lightweight, it’s relatively sturdy and should withstand multiple years of use. We assembled straight into the toddler bed without the (additional) toddler guard, and it does seem like it won't withstand any sizable force from an adult. Should be good for children under five.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on April 5, 2022
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Perfect for our expected little girl
reviews.reviewText: This is a great simple yet sturdy crib! It took awhile to put it all together but the instructions were adequate. With all the screws tightened, there is no movement in the crib...not a rock or a creak! It's shorter and closer to the ground than our old crib so my short wife will have no problem reaching the baby even with the mattress in the lowest of the three positions. The crib came with a cute little name card for it's occupant which was a really nice touch. After putting together the basic crib, there are extra screws and an extra piece of wood but all that is for concerting the crib to one of it's other 4 uses.My only complaint was the difficulty with which the mattress frame needed to be screwed in to the crib. I needed my wife's help to push and pull the crib so that I could have enough room to screw in the mattress frame. That being said, there is absolutely no doubt that it's secure and won't go anywhere!My wife and I are excited to use this for our expected little girl!
